description.name: Python
description.short_description: A high-level programming language used for web dev, data analysis, and AI.
description.long_description: Python is a powerful, readable, and widely-used language with a large ecosystem of libraries for web development, data science, machine learning, automation, and scripting. It is beginner-friendly and versatile.

description.name: Flask
description.short_description: A lightweight Python web framework for building APIs and web apps.
description.long_description: Flask is a minimal and flexible Python web framework that makes building small to medium web services and REST APIs straightforward with minimal boilerplate. Good for prototyping and lightweight apps.

description.name: Django
description.short_description: A high-level Python framework for rapid, secure web development.
description.long_description: Django follows convention over configuration with built-in admin, ORM, and security features—great for database-driven websites and web apps requiring robust structure.

description.name: FastAPI
description.short_description: A high-performance Python framework for building APIs using type hints.
description.long_description: FastAPI provides automatic docs (OpenAPI), async support, and type-driven validation—excellent for performant and well-documented APIs.
examples: Production-ready async REST APIs for ML inference

description.name: TensorFlow
description.short_description: An open-source ML framework for building and training neural networks.
description.long_description: TensorFlow is a comprehensive library developed by Google for building and training machine learning and deep learning models at scale, with tools for deployment.

description.name: Keras
description.short_description: A high-level API running on top of TensorFlow to simplify model building.
description.long_description: Keras provides a user-friendly, modular interface to quickly build and experiment with neural network architectures, integrated with TensorFlow.
examples: Prototyping neural networks using Sequential/Functional API

description.name: PyTorch
description.short_description: A flexible open-source deep learning framework favored by researchers.
description.long_description: PyTorch offers dynamic computation graphs and flexible APIs, making it popular for research and prototyping deep learning models and custom layers.

description.name: Scikit-learn
description.short_description: A Python library offering simple, efficient tools for classical ML algorithms.
description.long_description: Scikit-learn supplies well-tested implementations of classification, regression, clustering, and preprocessing algorithms suitable for medium-scale ML tasks.

description.name: Hugging Face Transformers
description.short_description: A library with pre-trained transformer models for NLP tasks.
description.long_description: The Hugging Face Transformers library exposes pretrained models (BERT, GPT, etc.) and tools for fine-tuning and inference in NLP workflows.

description.name: BERT
description.short_description: A transformer-based model for understanding language context.
description.long_description: BERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) is a pretrained model that captures contextual word meaning and is used for many NLP tasks.

description.name: NLTK
description.short_description: A Python toolkit for natural language processing and text analysis.
description.long_description: NLTK provides tokenizers, corpora, and utilities for text processing tasks such as tokenization, POS tagging, and simple classifiers; ideal for learning and prototyping.

description.name: OpenCV
description.short_description: An open-source library for image processing and computer vision.
description.long_description: OpenCV offers image and video processing algorithms (filters, detection, tracking, transformations) widely used in CV projects like face recognition or object detection.

description.name: YOLOv5
description.short_description: A fast real-time object detection model family (YOLO).
description.long_description: YOLOv5 is an efficient object-detection model optimized for speed and accuracy on images and video streams, common in real-time detection systems.
examples: Detecting cars, people, and traffic signs in video streams

description.name: MediaPipe
description.short_description: A framework for building real-time multimodal ML pipelines (pose, face, hands).
description.long_description: MediaPipe provides prebuilt solutions and performant pipelines for tasks like pose estimation, hand tracking, and face detection for real-time apps.

description.name: BeautifulSoup
description.short_description: A Python library to parse HTML and extract data.
description.long_description: BeautifulSoup makes it easy to extract data from HTML/XML documents for web scraping and preprocessing datasets for analysis.
examples: Scraping product info from e-commerce sites
Extracting article text from web pages

description.name: React
description.short_description: A JavaScript library for building UI using reusable components.
description.long_description: React helps build interactive, component-based frontends with unidirectional data flow and hooks for state management; commonly paired with Node/Express backends.

description.name: Node.js
description.short_description: A JavaScript runtime for server-side programming using V8 engine.
description.long_description: Node.js enables writing backend services in JavaScript, with an event-driven model suitable for I/O-bound apps and microservices.

description.name: JavaScript
description.short_description: A scripting language enabling interactivity in web pages and servers.
description.long_description: JavaScript runs in browsers and on servers (Node.js), enabling dynamic UI behavior, DOM manipulation, and asynchronous programming with promises/async.

description.name: PHP
description.short_description: A server-side scripting language commonly used for web development.
description.long_description: PHP is widely used for server-rendered web apps and content-management systems (e.g., WordPress); it integrates easily with relational databases.

description.name: MySQL
description.short_description: A popular open-source relational database for structured data.
description.long_description: MySQL stores and queries structured data using SQL; used widely for web applications requiring ACID transactions and relational schemas.

description.name: SQLite
description.short_description: A lightweight, file-based SQL database for small apps and mobile.
description.long_description: SQLite is an embedded SQL database engine stored in a single file, ideal for prototyping, local apps, and mobile where a full DB server is unnecessary.

description.name: Firebase
description.short_description: Google's platform for realtime DB, auth, storage, and hosting.
description.long_description: Firebase offers real-time databases, authentication, cloud functions, and storage for rapid mobile and web app development without managing servers.

description.name: MongoDB
description.short_description: A document-oriented NoSQL database using JSON-like storage.
description.long_description: MongoDB stores flexible JSON-like documents, suitable for schemaless or evolving data models and horizontal scaling with sharding.

description.name: Arduino
description.short_description: An open-source electronics platform for building hardware prototypes.
description.long_description: Arduino microcontroller boards allow developers to read sensors and control actuators, ideal for simple embedded and IoT projects.

description.name: Raspberry Pi
description.short_description: A low-cost single-board computer used for programming and IoT.
description.long_description: Raspberry Pi provides a full Linux environment on tiny hardware, good for edge computing, IoT gateways, and small servers.

description.name: ESP8266
description.short_description: A low-cost Wi-Fi microcontroller for IoT devices.
description.long_description: ESP8266 modules allow Wi-Fi connectivity on embedded devices and are commonly used to build low-power IoT sensors and actuators.
examples: Sending sensor data to server over Wi-Fi

description.name: Blynk
description.short_description: A mobile/IOT platform to build interfaces for hardware control.
description.long_description: Blynk simplifies building mobile dashboards to control and monitor microcontrollers remotely without building a custom backend.
examples: Mobile controls for home automation using Blynk app

description.name: C++
description.short_description: A high-performance programming language for system-level programming.
description.long_description: C++ offers low-level memory control and high performance, commonly used in system software, real-time systems, and performance-critical applications.

description.name: C#
description.short_description: An object-oriented language from Microsoft for Windows and web apps.
description.long_description: C# is used to build desktop, web, and game applications (via .NET and Unity), with strong typing and modern language features.

description.name: Java
description.short_description: A popular object-oriented language for enterprise and Android.
description.long_description: Java runs on the JVM and is widely used for large-scale backend systems and Android mobile application development.

description.name: Django
description.short_description: A high-level Python framework for rapid, secure web development.
description.long_description: Django follows convention over configuration with built-in admin, ORM, and security features—great for database-driven websites and web apps.

description.name: YOLOv5
description.short_description: A fast real-time object detection model family.
description.long_description: YOLOv5 is an efficient object-detection model optimized for speed and accuracy on images and video streams, common in real-time detection systems.
examples: Detecting cars, people, and traffic signs in video.

description.name: BERT
description.short_description: A transformer-based model for understanding language context.
description.long_description: BERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) is a pretrained model that captures contextual word meaning and is used for many NLP tasks.

description.name: BeautifulSoup
description.short_description: A Python library to parse HTML and extract data.
description.long_description: BeautifulSoup makes it easy to extract data from HTML/XML documents for web scraping and preprocessing datasets for analysis.
examples: Scraping product info or article text from web pages.

description.name: Streamlit
description.short_description: A Python framework to quickly create interactive ML web apps.
description.long_description: Streamlit lets you build data apps and demos with minimal code—great for sharing models and dashboards during development.
examples: Model demo pages, simple dashboards for prototypes.

description.name: FastAPI
description.short_description: A high-performance Python framework for building APIs using type hints.
description.long_description: FastAPI provides automatic docs (OpenAPI), async support, and type-driven validation—excellent for performant and well-documented APIs.
examples: Production-ready async REST APIs for ML inference.

description.name: Bootstrap
description.short_description: A front-end framework for responsive websites with prebuilt components.
description.long_description: Bootstrap accelerates UI development with style utilities, grid systems, and reusable components to build responsive layouts quickly.
examples: Responsive navbars, form styling, grid layout.

description.name: Power BI
description.short_description: Microsoft's tool for interactive data visualization and dashboards.
description.long_description: Power BI allows non-technical users to create interactive reports, dashboards, and visualizations connected to many data sources.

description.name: Tableau
description.short_description: A data visualization tool for interactive charts and dashboards.
description.long_description: Tableau helps analysts transform raw data into visually compelling and interactive reports for exploration and storytelling.

description.name: MATLAB
description.short_description: A numeric computing environment for modeling and simulations.
description.long_description: MATLAB provides toolboxes for signal processing, control systems, and numerical computation commonly used in engineering and research.
examples: Signal processing, matrix computations, prototyping algorithms.

description.name: Solidity
description.short_description: A programming language for writing smart contracts on Ethereum.
description.long_description: Solidity is a statically typed language for authoring smart contracts that run on EVM-compatible blockchains like Ethereum.
examples: Writing token contracts and decentralized voting logic.

description.name: Ethereum
description.short_description: A decentralized blockchain platform to build DApps and smart contracts.
description.long_description: Ethereum enables deploying decentralized applications and immutable smart contracts with a global consensus network and token standards.
examples: Deploying smart contracts and interacting via Web3.

description.name: Web3.js
description.short_description: A JavaScript library to interact with Ethereum nodes and smart contracts.
description.long_description: Web3.js provides APIs to read blockchain state, send transactions, and call smart contract methods from a JavaScript environment.
examples: Calling a contract function from a web app.

description.name: MetaMask
description.short_description: A browser wallet for managing Ethereum accounts and dApp interactions.
description.long_description: MetaMask is a browser extension and mobile wallet that manages private keys and interacts with Ethereum dApps through injected web3 providers.
examples: Connecting a web app to MetaMask for transactions.

description.name: SMTP
description.short_description: The protocol used for sending emails across the Internet.
description.long_description: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) defines how email messages are routed and delivered from client to server and between servers.
examples: Sending verification emails from backend servers.

description.name: SpeechRecognition
description.short_description: A Python library enabling speech-to-text conversions.
description.long_description: SpeechRecognition provides interfaces to several speech APIs and engines to convert spoken audio into text for voice-enabled applications.
examples: Turning microphone input into text for a voice assistant.

description.name: Dlib
description.short_description: A toolkit with ML algorithms used for face detection and recognition.
description.long_description: Dlib contains implementations of popular ML algorithms and tools for facial landmark detection, object detection, and model training.

description.name: MediaPipe
description.short_description: A framework for building real-time multimodal ML pipelines (pose, face, hands).
description.long_description: MediaPipe provides prebuilt solutions and performant pipelines for tasks like pose estimation, hand tracking, and face detection for real-time apps.
examples: Pose estimation for fitness apps using MediaPipe.

description.name: Servo Motor
description.short_description: A motor enabling precise angular control for robotics and IoT.
description.long_description: Servo motors allow precise control of angular position using PWM signals and are commonly used in robotics and automation.
examples: Used to control the angle of robotic arms or locks.

description.name: Sensor
description.short_description: A device that detects physical changes and converts them into electrical signals.
description.long_description: Sensors detect environmental changes (motion, temperature, humidity) and are key components in IoT systems to collect data from the physical world.
examples: DHT11 for temperature/humidity, ultrasonic for distance.

description.name: RNN
description.short_description: Recurrent Neural Network — model for sequential data.
description.long_description: RNNs are neural architectures designed to handle sequences by keeping hidden states over time, commonly used for text, speech, and time-series tasks.

description.name: CNN
description.short_description: Convolutional Neural Network — ideal for images and vision tasks.
description.long_description: CNNs use convolutional layers to automatically extract spatial features helpful in image classification, object detection, and segmentation.

description.name: API
description.short_description: An interface that allows software components to communicate.
description.long_description: APIs define the rules and data formats for interaction between software systems, e.g., RESTful APIs that use HTTP for client-server communication.

description.name: GitHub
description.short_description: A platform for hosting code and collaborating with version control.
description.long_description: GitHub hosts Git repositories, offers pull requests, issues, and CI/CD integrations to manage code and collaboration workflows.
examples: Push code, create PRs, use Actions for CI.

description.name: REST API
description.short_description: A style of web API using HTTP methods and stateless communication.
description.long_description: REST uses HTTP verbs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), resources, and status codes to create interoperable web services.
examples: CRUD endpoints for a resource-driven service.

description.name: Hugging Face Transformers
description.short_description: A library with pre-trained transformer models for NLP tasks.
description.long_description: The Hugging Face Transformers library exposes pretrained models (BERT, GPT, etc.) and tools for fine-tuning and inference in NLP workflows.
examples: Text classification, text generation, sequence labeling.

description.name: Postman
description.short_description: A platform to test and automate APIs and collaborate on API design.
description.long_description: Postman offers a UI for sending HTTP requests, testing endpoints, documenting APIs, and running automated test collections.

description.name: Docker
description.short_description: A container platform that packages apps with their dependencies.
description.long_description: Docker containers ensure consistent execution environments by packaging application code and runtime dependencies into lightweight, reproducible containers.
examples: Containerizing a Flask app for deployment.

description.name: Linux
description.short_description: An open-source OS widely used for servers and development.
description.long_description: Linux distributions power servers, development environments, and embedded devices; common tools include the Bash shell, package managers, and systemd.
examples: Running servers, development on Ubuntu or Debian.

description.name: FastAPI
description.short_description: A high-performance Python framework for building APIs using type hints.
description.long_description: FastAPI provides automatic docs (OpenAPI), async support, and type-driven validation—excellent for performant and well-documented APIs.
examples: Production-ready async REST APIs for ML inference

description.name: Transformers
description.short_description: State-of-the-art natural language processing library by Hugging Face.
description.long_description: Provides thousands of pre-trained models for NLP tasks like text classification, generation, translation, and question answering. Based on transformer architecture.

description.name: WebSockets
description.short_description: Full-duplex communication protocol for real-time web applications.
description.long_description: Enables persistent, low-latency connections between client and server for real-time data exchange, ideal for chat apps, live notifications, and gaming.

description.name: LoRa
description.short_description: Long Range, low-power wireless communication technology for IoT devices.
description.long_description: LoRa enables long-distance communication (up to 15 km) with minimal power consumption, making it ideal for battery-operated IoT sensors in smart cities and agriculture.

description.name: WebGL/Three.js
description.short_description: JavaScript libraries for 3D graphics and animations in web browsers.
description.long_description: WebGL provides low-level access to GPU for 3D rendering, while Three.js is a high-level library that simplifies creating 3D scenes, models, and animations directly in the browser.

description.name: Biofeedback Sensors
description.short_description: Sensors that measure physiological signals like heart rate, skin conductance, and brain waves.
description.long_description: These sensors capture biological data for health monitoring, stress management, and human-computer interaction applications, enabling real-time physiological feedback systems.

description.name: ML-Agents
description.short_description: Unity's machine learning toolkit for creating intelligent game characters.
description.long_description: Allows training intelligent NPCs using reinforcement learning, imitation learning, and other ML techniques within the Unity game engine.

description.name: WebRTC
description.short_description: Web Real-Time Communication for peer-to-peer audio, video, and data transfer.
description.long_description: Enables direct browser-to-browser communication without plugins, supporting video conferencing, file sharing, and screen sharing applications.

description.name: ESP32/ESP8266
description.short_description: Low-cost, Wi-Fi enabled microcontrollers for IoT projects.
description.long_description: ESP32 and ESP8266 are popular IoT development boards with built-in Wi-Fi, GPIO pins, and low power consumption, ideal for connected devices and smart home projects.

description.name: VS Code Extensions
description.short_description: Plugins that extend Visual Studio Code functionality for various programming languages and workflows.
description.long_description: Extensions enhance VS Code with language support, debugging, linting, theming, and productivity features, creating a customized development environment.
